  1. News & Announcements
    See the latest press releases from Heber City

  1. Envision Heber 2050

    Envision Heber 2050 invites all Heber City residents, community members and stakeholders to the kickoff of the visioning phase of the 2019 Heber City General Plan development process. Read on...

  2. Preparing for Flooding

    As the Mayor of Heber, I am concerned about the potential for anything that could cause harm or destruction in our city. With such a large snowpack this year and a cold spring it is time to consider the possibility of flooding and prepare accordingly. Read on...

  3. Muirfield Dog Park Improvement Project

    Heber City will be making improvements to the Muirfield Dog Park. Improvements will include separate play areas for both large and small dogs, new landscaping, covered benches, dog play features, multi-level drinking fountains, trail improvements, and Read on...

  4. A MESSAGE FROM OUR MAYOR - CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES

    “It does not do to leave a live dragon out of your calculations, if you live near him.” - J.R.R. Tolkien As everyone is aware the big story in Heber and the State of Utah right now is growth. Growth isn’t exactly a live dragon but can certainly wreak hav Read on...

  5. Notice of Municipal Elections

    The Heber City Municipal General Election will be held November 5, 2019 for three City Council Members, each with a 4-year term. Candidate filing period is Monday, June 3, through Friday, June 7, 2019. Read on...

  6. 3RD ANNUAL WASATCH P.E.A.K (Parents Empowering Abled Kids)- I CAN DO HARD THINGS 5K

    This race is sponsored by a group of parents in Wasatch County in support of our special needs children. This event will raise money to give these special children, ages 3-22 years old, Saturday, April 27, 2019, 10:00am at Wasatch High School Track Read on...

  7. HEBER VALLEY PARKWAY COMMUNITY FORUM

    Do you have questions about the Heber Valley Parkway project? Would you like to know more about the Parkway and/or Main Street planning studies? On April 17, 2019 from 6:30 to 8:30 pm, an informal community forum will be held in the community Read on...

  8. Public Hearing Notices

    Public Hearing Notices given for the Heber City Council and the Heber City Planning Commission will be posted here. Meetings will be held in the Heber City Office Building, 75 North Main Street, South door, in the Council Chambers upstairs Read on...

  9. Food Trucks by Firelight

    Heber City is hosting “Food Trucks by Firelight” every Monday, Friday, and Saturday night from 5:00 pm – 8:00 pm at City Hall. Multiple food trucks will be available, so come join the fun! Read on...

  10. D-Day Commemoration Events 75th Anniversary

    D-Day June 6, 2019 - 9am-4prn North American T-6 honor flights and rides B-17 static display and tours Commemorative L-4 flights Museum tours Danny Newell Swing Dance Band l1am-lpm Food Truck wwn re-enactment WWII vehicles Kids activities D-Day video pro Read on...

  11. Cemetery Cremation Niches

    Cremation Niches are now available for purchase in the new Cremation Niche Wall at the Heber City Cemetery. Prices vary from $725 - $975 depending upon the location in the niche wall and residency. Please contact Read on...

  12. New Employment Opportunities

    View our employment opportunities on the employment page. Additional Info...

  13. FOG - ATTENTION! Heber Food Service Establishments and Manufactures

    What is F.O.G.? FOG stands for FATS, OILS and GREASE It is the number one cause of sewer system blockages in Heber City. FOG sticks to the walls of your plumbing and the sewer system and can build up over time. Eventually, it can block your plumbing or Read on...

  14. Heber City Newsletters

    Wondering what is new and happening within Heber City? No worries, you can read all the latest Heber City Newsletters online. All newsletters are posted here, and available to read online, or download for you to view later. Additional Info...

  15. AMENDED NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING SCHEDULE FOR HEBER CITY COUNCIL

    Notice is hereby given that the Heber City Council will conduct its regular council meetings on the first and third Tuesdays of each month at the Heber City Municipal Building, located at 75 North Main Street, Heber City, Utah, beginning at 6:00 p.m. Read on...

  16. Stay connected!

    Subscribe to Notify Me to receive updates and information about community news and happenings. Read on...

  17. Keep in Touch

    Stay in touch with us by following us on Twitter, becoming our friend on Facebook, or subscribing to one of our RSS Feeds.

  18. Website Personalization Now Available!

    With the launch of the new MyAccount feature, visitors to our website can now customize their viewing experience! Read on...

  1. Community Spotlight
    Find out what Heber City has to offer

  1. Wasatch High School FBLA Earns 10th Straight State Title

    Wasatch High School Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA) took first in the state for the 10th consecutive year. The Utah FBLA State Leadership Conference was held at the Davis Conference Center March 11th-13th, 2019. Wasatch competed against more Read on...

  2. Envision Heber 2050

    Envision Heber 2050 invites all Heber City residents, community members and stakeholders to the kickoff of the visioning phase of the 2019 Heber City General Plan development process. Read on...

  3. Community Assistance Programs

    There are many local resources available for those in our community that are in need of assistance. We have a few resources listed with links to their websites, and will continue to grow this list of resources. Additional Info...

  4. Welcome to Heber Valley - Utah's Backyard Playground!

    Visiting the picturesque Heber Valley is the perfect way of enjoying one of Mother Nature's favorite destinations. Read on...

  5. Timpanogos Valley Theater Company

    Timpanogos Valley Theater Company was founded in 2001 and incorporated as a non-profit organization September 17, 2004. Its specific mission is to provide a forum and a venue for the people of Wasatch County to study, compose, play write, train, reh Read on...

  6. Request a Police Report

    Find out how to request a police report from the Heber City Police Department. Read on...
